titleStmt.title: དོན་འགྲེལ་སྒྲོན་མ།
don 'grel sgron ma/
The Lamp, A Commentary on the Meaning [of the Vajrapāṇi Sādhana]

notesStmt.note: Last updated at 07/09/2018 at 10:06:12 by admin

No title is given either at the beginning or in the colophon to the text. The title provided by the Derge Dkar-chag is taken from the concluding verse of the work, which reads: “regarding these personal instructions clarifying the sādhana, having condensed the meaning of just that with these thirty lines of verse, the virtue of having composed this lamp, a commentary on the meaning that it makes known, is dedicated to all sentient beings” (sgrub thabs gsal bar byed pa'i man ngag 'di, tshig rkang sum cus de nyid don bsdus nas, shes par byed pa'i don 'grel sgron ma 'di, byas pa'i dge ba sems can kun la bsngo).

The fact that the body of the text contains thirty lines of verse as stated in the concluding stanzas would seem to imply that the text was composed in Tibetan since one would expect half that number if the original composition were in Sanskrit.
